channel.title: Woodhouse Curated Podcasts
channel.description: A curated podcast playlist feed managed by Woodhouse.
channel.itunes:author: Woodhouse

item.title: Charlie Songhurst – Lessons from Investing in 483 Companies [Invest Like the Best, CLASSICS]
item.description:
Charlie Songhurst is a brilliant strategist, accomplished executive, and prolific angel investor. Former head of strategy at Microsoft, he has personally invested in nearly 500 companies.

This episode is one of Patrick O'Shaughnessy's all-time favorite conversations. Topics include:

  • Power, money, and fame — how people stack rank their vices
  • Lessons from investing in 483 companies
  • Strategy insights from Microsoft
  • Angel investing philosophy

Originally published July 2020, re-released as a Classic in June 2025.

Full show notes: joincolossus.com

item.title: #840: Bill Gurley — Investing in The AI Era, 10 Days in China, and Important Life Lessons from Bob Dylan, Jerry Seinfeld, MrBeast, and More
item.description:
Bill Gurley (@bgurley) is a general partner at Benchmark, a leading venture capital firm in Silicon Valley. His new book is Runnin’ Down a Dream: How to Thrive in a Career You Actually Love.

This episode is brought to you by:

  • Momentous high-quality creatine for cognitive and muscular support
  • Our Place’s Titanium Always Pan® Pro using nonstick technology that’s coating-free and made without PFAS, otherwise known as “Forever Chemicals”
  • Shopify global commerce platform, providing tools to start, grow, market, and manage a retail business
  • Coyote the card game​, which I co-created with Exploding Kittens

*

Timestamps:

  • [00:00:00] Start.
  • [00:01:43] The book that gave Jerry Seinfeld permission to pursue comedy and inspired Runnin’ Down a Dream.
  • [00:03:59] AI bubble or not?
  • [00:06:33] Circular deals and SPV chaos.
  • [00:12:01] Angel investing in the AI era.
  • [00:14:32] Why you should be the most AI-enabled version of yourself, regardless of field.
  • [00:20:47] China deep dive: Ten days, six cities, high-speed trains, and a Xiaomi SU7 factory tour.
  • [00:22:43] Communism misconceptions.
  • [00:25:40] Lei Jun: The Steve Jobs of China.
  • [00:29:17] Jack Ma, ByteDance’s invisible CEO, and the risks of prominence in China.
  • [00:32:11] America vs. China (Lawyers vs. engineers).
  • [00:41:01] Keys for US competitiveness.
  • [00:43:47] Bill is bullish on these countries.
  • [00:47:30] Matthew McConaughey’s “Don’t half ass it” moment.
  • [00:49:45] Runnin’ Down a Dream thesis: Helping people pursue X instead of A, B, or C.
  • [00:51:03] The 80,000-hour question.
  • [00:52:47] The self-learning test.
  • [00:56:58] Bob Dylan as music expeditionary.
  • [01:00:27] Go to the epicenter where the action is.
  • [01:10:56] Danny Meyer’s pivot.
  • [01:13:30] Working for free.
  • [01:19:37] Never too late: Tito Beveridge started Tito’s Vodka at 40.
  • [01:21:51] AI sanity checks.
  • [01:25:59] AI-proof bets.
  • [01:29:13] Sam Hinkie’s Moneyball moment.
  • [01:32:37] Competitive strategy, avoiding false failures, and regret minimalization.
  • [01:43:46] Purpose, Progress, and Prosperity — the P3 Policy Institute.
  • [01:47:18] Regulatory capture explained.
  • [01:51:55] Why the IPO market is broken.
  • [02:01:52] Stablecoins putting Visa and Mastercard on notice.
  • [02:03:40] Hopes for Runnin’ Down a Dream and parting thoughts.

*

For show notes and past guests on The Tim Ferriss Show, please visit tim.blog/podcast.

For deals from sponsors of The Tim Ferriss Show, please visit tim.blog/podcast-sponsors

item.title: #2206 - Chamath Palihapitiya - The Joe Rogan Experience
item.description:
Chamath Palihapitiya is a venture capitalist, engineer, and CEO of Social Capital. Formerly a Facebook executive, he is a prolific investor and host of the All-In Podcast.

Topics discussed:

  • Venture capital and technology investing
  • Artificial intelligence and its implications
  • Politics, media, and culture
  • Business strategy and decision-making

Original air date: September 25, 2024

Learn more: chamath.substack.com

item.title: #2447 - Mike Benz - The Joe Rogan Experience
item.description:
Mike Benz is a former State Department official and free speech advocate. He has become known for his deep research into government censorship, intelligence agencies, and elite networks.

Topics discussed:

  • The 3.5 million pages of Epstein files released by the DOJ
  • Epstein as a "professional fixer" between intelligence agencies and private sector
  • CIA connections to the mob going back to the 1930s
  • How offshore money networks operate
  • The "pizzagate denialist" problem
  • Why the TikTok ban is really about narrative control

Original air date: February 5, 2026

item.title: #2422 - Jensen Huang - The Joe Rogan Experience
item.description:
Jensen Huang is the founder and CEO of Nvidia, the chip company powering the AI revolution. He transformed Nvidia from a near-bankrupt startup in 1995 to the dominant force in AI computing.

Topics discussed:

  • Why Trump's "drill baby drill" energy policy saved AI in America
  • 90% of knowledge will be AI-generated within 2-3 years
  • Why AI won't achieve consciousness
  • How Sega accidentally saved Nvidia in the 1990s
  • His work schedule: up at 4am, thousands of emails daily, no days off (not even holidays)
  • Nvidia's role across every industry from farming to space
  • Why jobs are not tasks and how to stay relevant as automation spreads

Original air date: December 6, 2025
